captions.text: - [Voiceover] Why it's so hard
to say hello to someone.
You know the situation.
You see someone you don't really know,
and it's not clear whether you're going
to say hello to each other or not.

They probably don't even
remember meeting you,

and they'll think you're some
kind of weirdo if you say hi.

All you need is a little eye
contact and you'd say it,
but they're busy with their stuff,
and you're not just gonna stare at them.

So you look at the wall,
and then the ground.
Did they just look at you?
That was your chance and you blew it!
OK, maybe if you just keep looking at them

they'll glance up and then
you'll get that eye contact,
and you'll have a nice, normal hello!
In fact, it'll be a fuckin' great hello!
- (very slowly) How's it going?
- (very slowly) Hey!
- [Voiceover] This feels weird.
It's gone on too long.
Look away, abort.
You know what, why is this up to you?
Why do people need to say hello anyway?

You both clearly have a
purpose, which is walking,
and hello-ing is just...
Was that a glance?
That was your chance, you idiot!
Hello them!

- Hello!
(birds chirping)
- [Voiceover] Well, that was nice.
At least it's a step up from last time.
- Hey!
(slap)
(upbeat organ music)

title: Why It’s So Hard To Say Hello

comments.text:
I'm Swedish, I never say hi to anyone. Old classmates? Nope. People who 
kind of used to be your friend but you don't hang out with anymore? Nope. I 
only say hi if the other person says hi to me first. But they don't, 
because I always look somewhere else, usually at my phone. I don't know why 
it's so hard for me, but I hate saying hi to people. They probably think 
I'm rude but I don't care.﻿
